title: Reactions: 250K full gas at the Tour de France
content:
When all was said and done, Matej Mohorič won stage 7 of the Tour de France solo, and Mathieu van der Poel (Alpecin-Fenix) kept yellow, but the peloton had been through the equivalent of a 12-round boxing match – 250 kilometers full gas.

The longest stage of the Tour in 21 years did not disappoint as the riders came out swinging from the start gun, finishing more than 20 minutes ahead of the fastest estimated time for the stage.

Judging by their tweets, there will be many tired and sore legs tomorrow. Enjoy!

Man these Italian footballers look in pain #warriors :man-facepalming:

— Geraint Thomas (@GeraintThomas86) July 2, 2021

Oh dear god, I’m super tired ☠️ #TDF2021

— Jacopo Guarnieri (@jacopoguarnieri) July 2, 2021

Day 7 @LeTour ! My face says easy day , but…. NO #TDF2021 pic.twitter.com/TzIwB9y8b4

— Tosh Van der Sande (@Toshvds) July 2, 2021

@markcavendish doing a fantastic job at bringing me to the front in the battle for the break 🤘🏻Unfortunately I didn’t get a lot of wiggle room in the group but moved up to top 3 in gc 😂 I’m not sure how long I’ll remain there but let’s see how the legs are in the big mountains pic.twitter.com/0WUXBNAQZr

— Kasper Asgreen (@k_asgreen) July 2, 2021
— Jasper Stuyven (@Jasperstuyven) July 2, 2021

Some stage… Brave attack from @RichardCarapazM, one of many to come. We promised an offensive race, we’ll keep trying 💪🏻 @INEOSGrenadiers #TDF2021
